intro: Galium harcynicum var. transiens, commonly known as the Transylvanian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
